alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake Valley (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 4:00AM MST until January 08 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Through noon Wednesday, total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches possible, with up to 6 inches on the benches. From noon Wednesday through Thursday afternoon, another 5 to 9 inches of snow is possible, with up to 12 inches on the benches. * WHERE...Salt Lake Valley. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday morning through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow squall conditions are possible Wednesday afternoon and evening, bringing potential impacts to the evening commute. More snowfall is likely beyond Thursday, with more active weather on the way.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov.
